ACT
129
Transfer of the estate to the heirs
At the time of the testator's death, the heir acquires the right of inheritance and by force of law the estate of the deceased person passes to him, thereby becoming his inheritance.
At the same time, the heir also acquires other rights and obligations related to his capacity as heir, unless otherwise derived from their legal nature.
The heir remains an heir permanently, unless he/she validly waives his/her right to inherit (renunciation of inheritance).
The same applies to the acquisition of the right to a record, as well as to the acquisition of a record.
